details:
Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in potrace.


* [CVE-2013-7437](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2013-7437)
Multiple integer overflows in potrace 1.11 allow remote attackers
 to cause a denial of service (crash) via large dimensions in a BMP
 image, which triggers a buffer overflow.
 This bug was reported by Murray McAllister of the Red Hat
 Security Response Team.
* [CVE-2016-8694](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-8694) /
 [CVE-2016-8695](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-8695) /
 [CVE-2016-8696](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-8696)
Multiple NULL pointer dereferences in bm\_readbody\_bmp.
 This bug was discovered by Agostino Sarubbo of Gentoo.
* [CVE-2016-8697](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-8697)
Division by zero in bm\_new.
 This bug was discovered by Agostino Sarubbo of Gentoo.
* [CVE-2016-8698](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-8698) /
 [CVE-2016-8699](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-8699) /
 [CVE-2016-8700](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-8700) /
 [CVE-2016-8701](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-8701) /
 [CVE-2016-8702](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-8702) /
 [CVE-2016-8703](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-8703)
Multiple heap-based buffer overflows in bm\_readbody\_bmp.
 This bug was discovered by Agostino Sarubbo of Gentoo.


For Debian 7 Wheezy, these problems have been fixed in version
1.10-1+deb7u1.


We recommend that you upgrade your potrace packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
